Hell yeah! Intention is getting translated. This is so amazing and freaking hot!!! I love this Netori! This have really good plot, good MC and "Intention" also have many next chapters. I hope this will be translated too.

Part 3: Overall, really awesome raw story with incredible art to support it by Kenji sensei, and am glad to see him actually approach the NTR genre differently and making it palpable to enjoy, both as fap material and short story. His works are just really enjoyable to read, and even have a sense of realism to them. Would not mind seeing a continuation to this, but it ended really  well all around. Good build up, believable premise, and just pretty satisfactory overall, especially having the MC tell her the truth she did not want to accept, even though she knew deep down inside that Akira never cared, and she should have been faithful to her kind husband. At least she has the private eye to confide in.

Part 2: Her past relationship with Akira adds to why she would cheat with him instead of some random. Akira is just pure scum of the earth, since he married for status within the company he works for, and just played with Sayaka 's dedication to him by telling her "sweet nothings" as soon as she realized what happened once caught. If he really cared, he would have married her, but it goes to show he only cared for himself,  and he still does this on top having a child with his actual wife. This private eye, really just told her how it was, and in a way, almost created an oddly bitter sweet ending for her by saying that he knows who she truly is and what she has gone through, and would even forgive her.

Was a little worried seeing an NTR from Kenji sensei since I am more familiar with his vanilla/ambiguous works, but I have to say, this was a welcome change to the genre and recent additions we have seen this week. Like others have said, the private detective said what many others have thought or we hoped to see said by the husband. But what makes this story even better is that it goes add some complexity to the characters involved within the first 5 pages, specifically Sayaka and Akira. Sayaka is definitely in the wrong with her infidelity, but it is much more understandable compared to other heroines since she seemed to have a deeper relationship with Akira compared to her current husband, who she most likely married because she did not want to wait too long to start a family.

Zero sympathy for the MILF. Yes, she's being blackmailed but she was cheating with another man without  any concern for her husband or son. Worst of all, she seems to only be doing it for teh lulz. She fully understands that there is no future with the other dude but does it anyway. She has no excuse
